questions.question: What is the name of the spiritual realm of fullness in Gnostic cosmology?
questions.answer: Pleroma

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, who is responsible for creating the material world?
questions.answer: The Demiurge

questions.question: What is the term for divine emanations or attributes of God in Gnostic cosmology?
questions.answer: Aeons

questions.question: Which Aeon is often associated with the creation of the Demiurge in Gnostic myths?
questions.answer: Sophia

questions.question: What is the Gnostic term for the flawed creator god, often identified with the Old Testament God?
questions.answer: Demiurge

questions.question: In Gnostic anthropology, what is trapped within the human body?
questions.answer: A divine spark

questions.question: What are the malevolent spiritual beings that govern the material world in Gnostic thought?
questions.answer: Archons

questions.question: What is the ultimate goal of Gnostic spirituality?
choices: To remain in the material world
questions.answer: To achieve gnosis

questions.question: Which type of human in Gnostic categorization is considered capable of achieving full gnosis?
questions.answer: Pneumatics

questions.question: What does the term 'gnosis' refer to in Gnostic thought?
questions.answer: Divine knowledge

questions.question: How do Gnostics view the material world?
choices: As a flawed or evil creation
As the true realm of the divine
questions.answer: As a flawed or evil creation

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view on salvation?
choices: It is achieved through faith alone
It is achieved through good works
It is achieved through acquiring secret knowledge
questions.answer: It is achieved through acquiring secret knowledge

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the relationship between the supreme God and the Demiurge?
choices: The Demiurge is superior to the supreme God
The supreme God created the Demiurge
The Demiurge is ignorant of the supreme God
questions.answer: The Demiurge is ignorant of the supreme God

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view on the nature of humanity?
choices: Humans are composite beings with a divine spark
Humans are manifestations of the Demiurge
questions.answer: Humans are composite beings with a divine spark

questions.question: Which group in Gnostic anthropology is considered to have a mixture of spiritual and material natures?
questions.answer: Psychics

questions.question: What is the Gnostic perspective on the origin of evil?
choices: Evil originates from human free will
Evil is a result of the Demiurge's ignorance
Evil is created by the supreme God
questions.answer: Evil is a result of the Demiurge's ignorance

questions.question: In Gnostic cosmology, what is the Pleroma composed of?
questions.answer: Divine emanations or Aeons

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view on the purpose of human existence?
choices: To multiply and populate the Earth
To escape the material world and return to the Pleroma
questions.answer: To escape the material world and return to the Pleroma

questions.question: How do Gnostics typically interpret the God of the Old Testament?
questions.answer: As the Demiurge

questions.question: What role do Archons play in Gnostic cosmology?
choices: They maintain the perfection of the material world
They keep humanity trapped in ignorance and materiality
They serve as intermediaries between humans and the supreme God
questions.answer: They keep humanity trapped in ignorance and materiality

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the significance of self-knowledge?
choices: It is irrelevant to spiritual growth
It leads to recognition of one's divine nature
It strengthens one's connection to the Demiurge
questions.answer: It leads to recognition of one's divine nature

questions.question: How does Gnostic cosmology differ from traditional Christian cosmology?
choices: Gnosticism sees the material world as good, while Christianity sees it as evil
Gnosticism posits multiple gods, while Christianity is monotheistic
Gnosticism views the creator as flawed, while Christianity sees the creator as perfect
Gnosticism denies the existence of evil, while Christianity acknowledges it
questions.answer: Gnosticism views the creator as flawed, while Christianity sees the creator as perfect

questions.question: What is the Gnostic perspective on the relationship between knowledge and salvation?
choices: Salvation comes through faith, not knowledge
Knowledge (gnosis) is the key to salvation
questions.answer: Knowledge (gnosis) is the key to salvation

questions.question: In Gnostic anthropology, what is the ultimate fate of the divine spark within humans?
choices: It is destined to remain trapped in matter forever
It aims to return to the Pleroma
questions.answer: It aims to return to the Pleroma

questions.question: How do Gnostics typically view the physical body?
choices: As a temple of the divine
As a necessary vehicle for spiritual growth
As a prison for the divine spark
questions.answer: As a prison for the divine spark

questions.question: What is the Gnostic interpretation of the biblical serpent in the Garden of Eden?
choices: As a bringer of beneficial knowledge
questions.answer: As a bringer of beneficial knowledge

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the significance of the concept of 'fullness' (pleroma)?
choices: It represents the realm of the Demiurge
It symbolizes the perfection and totality of the divine realm
It describes the state of human ignorance
questions.answer: It symbolizes the perfection and totality of the divine realm

questions.question: How does Gnostic soteriology (doctrine of salvation) differ from orthodox Christian soteriology?
choices: Gnosticism emphasizes faith, while Christianity emphasizes knowledge
Gnosticism focuses on physical resurrection, while Christianity focuses on spiritual ascension
Gnosticism stresses secret knowledge, while Christianity emphasizes faith and grace
There is no significant difference between the two
questions.answer: Gnosticism stresses secret knowledge, while Christianity emphasizes faith and grace

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view on the nature of time and history?
choices: Time is cyclical and history repeats itself
Time and history are illusions created by the Demiurge
Time is linear and history is progressing towards a divine plan
Time and history are irrelevant to spiritual matters
questions.answer: Time and history are illusions created by the Demiurge

questions.question: In Gnostic texts, what often happens to the divine spark after death?
choices: It is reincarnated into another body
It ascends through celestial spheres to return to the Pleroma
questions.answer: It ascends through celestial spheres to return to the Pleroma
